abstract: If the two companies made a deal, it would be among the most prominent in a year that has been lacking in daring deal-making.
snippet: If the two companies made a deal, it would be among the most prominent in a year that has been lacking in daring deal-making.
lead_paragraph: For more than a century, Hershey — an American candy icon so well known it gave its name to its Pennsylvania hometown — has stood independent, rebuffing numerous attempts to buy the maker of Kisses and Reese’s Peanut Butter Cups.

headline.main: Hershey Rejects Mondelez’s $23 Billion Takeover Offer
headline.print_headline: Mondelez’s $23 Billion  Bid Rejected by Hershey

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Stephanie Strom

abstract: As of Friday, nearly all food labels in the state must disclose when products include genetically engineered ingredients.
snippet: As of Friday, nearly all food labels in the state must disclose when products include genetically engineered ingredients.
lead_paragraph: Nearly all food labels in Vermont are now required to disclose when products include genetically engineered ingredients. The requirement, passed two years ago, became effective on Friday.

headline.main: G.M.O.s in Food? Vermonters Will Know
headline.print_headline: G.M.O.s in Food? Now Vermonters Will Know, and So May You

abstract: Just days after the “Brexit” vote, companies and cities across Europe hope to profit by luring businesses and helping those wishing to move.
snippet: Just days after the “Brexit” vote, companies and cities across Europe hope to profit by luring businesses and helping those wishing to move.
lead_paragraph: Within hours of Britain’s vote to leave the European Union, it started.

abstract: Mark Carney, the governor of the central bank, also shrugged off a suggestion he might be forced to resign after a new prime minister was chosen.
snippet: Mark Carney, the governor of the central bank, also shrugged off a suggestion he might be forced to resign after a new prime minister was chosen.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The Bank of England may be forced to cut a key interest rate this summer as it grapples with economic uncertainty created by Britain’s vote to leave the European Union, Mark Carney, the bank’s governor, said in a speech on Thursday.

headline.main: Britain May Need to Cut Rates, Bank of England Chief Says
headline.print_headline: Caution From Bank of England

abstract: The Williams Companies is fighting a judge’s decision to allow a merger with Energy Transfer to be terminated, but appeals like these normally lose.
snippet: The Williams Companies is fighting a judge’s decision to allow a merger with Energy Transfer to be terminated, but appeals like these normally lose.
lead_paragraph: The Wiliams Companies is in Delaware court, appealing the termination of a contentious deal to merge with the pipeline operator Energy Transfer Equity. But if you want to understand the chances the Williams Companies has in winning its appeal, you need to understand merger agreements.

headline.main: Williams Faces Uphill Battle in Fight With Energy Transfer

abstract: The federal highway safety agency said that the driver of a Tesla on “autopilot” died in a crash in May, thought to be the first death in a self-driving car.
snippet: The federal highway safety agency said that the driver of a Tesla on “autopilot” died in a crash in May, thought to be the first death in a self-driving car.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT — The race by automakers and technology firms to develop self-driving cars has been fueled by the belief that computers can operate a vehicle more safely than human drivers.

headline.main: Self-Driving Tesla Was Involved in Fatal Crash, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: A Tesla Driver  Using Autopilot  Dies in a Crash

byline.original: By Bill Vlasic and Neal E. Boudette

abstract: After its $4.4 billion acquisition of Starz, Lionsgate plans to create a new class of nonvoting shares.
snippet: After its $4.4 billion acquisition of Starz, Lionsgate plans to create a new class of nonvoting shares.
lead_paragraph: The movie studio Lionsgate’s $4.4 billion deal to acquire the pay-TV company Starz has media mogul John C. Malone’s fingerprints all over it. A complex structure? Check. New governance-skewing nonvoting stock? Yup. More influence for the man known as the Cable Cowboy? You bet. Starz shareholders should not be surprised at the modest premium on the offer.

headline.main: Lionsgate’s Deal for Starz Bears Malone’s Hallmarks
headline.print_headline: Starz Media Mogul to Get Voting Rights at Lionsgate

byline.original: By Jennifer Saba and Richard Beales

abstract: Shareholders in Zenefits, a troubled human resources company, will get larger stakes as it tries to make up for the former chief executive’s unlawful corner-cutting.
snippet: Shareholders in Zenefits, a troubled human resources company, will get larger stakes as it tries to make up for the former chief executive’s unlawful corner-cutting.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Zenefits investors are getting a larger piece of the troubled human resources start-up because they overpaid for their stakes, unaware that the company’s sales teams flouted regulations to enhance growth, Zenefits announced on Thursday. The move will cut the company’s valuation in half, to about $2 billion.

headline.main: Zenefits Compensates Investors Over Past Misconduct
headline.print_headline: Zenefits Compensates Investors Over Former Chief’s Past Misconduct

byline.original: By Katie Benner and Mike Isaac
